com.veriplace.client
Class PermissionAPI

java.lang.Object
  com.veriplace.client.API
      com.veriplace.client.PermissionAPI

public class PermissionAPI
extends API

Interface for verifying or removing an application's OAuth Access Tokens, which represent permissions to locate specific users. The methods of this API are implemented as individual requests to the Veriplace server, and do not require redirects or user interaction.

An application may wish to verify an Access Token if it was previously cached, because users may have changed their privacy settings so that the token is no longer valid and location requests will fail. In this case the application may choose to restart the OAuth User Authorization process to obtain a new token.

An application can also delete the Access Token that it previously used to locate a user; this has the same effect as the user revoking permission for that application through the Veriplace website.

Since:
2.0

protected java.lang.String getURI(User user)
Description copied from class: API
Get the URI for the resource controlled by this API.

This URI is used in the OAuth user authorization redirect to identify what resource needs to be authorized.
